intro: Chaetopappa keerlioides, commonly known as the Keerlioides composite, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically features a branched stem with hairy leaves, and its yellow flowers are arranged in clusters. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
